body:
reverts https://github.com/neovim/neovim/commit/c855eee919f2d4edc9b9fa91b277454290fbabfe

This setting introduces constant CI failures on macos (see https://github.com/neovim/neovim/issues/23762). It's also of limited use while our scrollback buffer doesn't support reflow as well.

comment_regular_data.body: OK, I'm _done_ with this; the constant failures are untenable. I'm leaving the setting commented-out in case libvterm ever gets fixed.
WTF why does the terminal reflow (only!) on Windows even if it's not enabled o.O?!

> constant CI failures on macos (see #23762).

If that's a _crash_ which can affect users (not only CI), then yeah I guess disabling this makes sense. Otherwise the "limited use" is still useful IMO, especially for people like me who often use temporary vertical splits.

If CI is the only issue, can we work around that?

> If that's a crash which can affect users (not only CI), then yeah I guess disabling this makes sense. 

It is, but the situation is relatively academic.

> If CI is the only issue, can we work around that?

And short of disabling the test (which we probably don't want), I don't know what to do.
Shall we just disable the test and forget about it? If someone raises an issue, then we can disable reflow.

Just a note, I can easily reproduce this manually, as noted in the comments there, so disabling the reflow is probably a good idea
* https://github.com/neovim/neovim/issues/23762

I'm not on Linux currently, where I reproduced it in multiple terminals and shells as commented in the issue. But I just did it with the Windows terminal and WSL version of Neovim. It takes less than 10 seconds of rapidly resizing the terminal to crash it.  Just `nvim --clean` , `:terminal` and rapidly resize the Window. 

I can not reproduce it on the windows version of Neovim, but I can if I open a powershell prompt inside the WSL version.

Let's disable reflow for 0.10.0. we can always re-enable it for 0.10.x again if surprise libvterm patches appears during the cycle.

Let's disable tests on _windoze_ as needed to get this merged.
